task_summary: Detect the red can, approach, grasp it securely, and lift it from the tabletop.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene shows several small bottles/cans and a robot arm over a white table. The goal is to pick up the red can. The robot must first localize the can, open its gripper, align to a safe grasp pose, close the gripper to secure contact, and lift the can clear of the surface. Visual detection may require a short scan if the can is not initially visible. The plan prioritizes stable grasp verification before lifting and a brief hold after the lift to confirm success.
preconditions: Robot is homed and reachable workspace includes the red can
Gripper operational and free of objects
Table surface clear enough to approach the can
stepwise_plan: Perceive the red can; if not visible, scan then detect.
Open gripper to the required width.
Approach and align to the can with tight positional tolerance.
Compute a grasp pose and verify it is available.
Execute the grasp at the computed pose and close the gripper.
Verify grasp stability, then lift the can.
Confirm the object is in the gripper and hold briefly.
success_criteria: Red can is securely held by the gripper
Can is lifted at least 0.10 m above the table
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails: perform scan and re-detect
If grasp pose is unavailable: recompute pose
If grasp unstable: reopen, realign, and retry detection + grasp
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the red can is confirmed in the gripper after a successful lift and short hold.

frame_3.now_evidence: clear approach posture over the can with hand alignment visible
frame_3.predicts_next: finger closure and subsequent lifting will follow

node_specs.description: Active scan to localize the target if not initially visible.
Detect and estimate the pose of the target object.
Open the gripper to the commanded width.
Approach the target and align the end effector within tolerance.
Compute a feasible grasp pose and store it on the blackboard.
Check that a pose with the given key exists on the blackboard.
Execute the grasp motion at the stored pose.
Close the gripper to apply the specified force.
Verify that the grasp is mechanically stable.
Lift the held object vertically to clear the table.
Confirm the specified object is currently grasped.
Hold the object steady for a short duration.

failure_modes: Target not detected due to occlusion or glare
recovery_strategy: Abort if repeated failures after safety timeout
assumptions: The red can is the red cylindrical object visible on the table.
Side grasp is feasible; if top grasp were required, strategy would change.
Lighting and camera calibration are adequate for detection.

expected_success_criteria: Red can lifted â‰¥0.10 m and remains in gripper
